meanings.definition: A person or entity that imposes a financial charge on others.
meanings.sent1: The taxor collected money from everyone in the town.
meanings.sent2: The government is the main taxor in our country.
meanings.sent3: The taxor decided to charge extra for late payments.
meanings.sent4: The taxor's presence loomed over the citizens like a dark cloud.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the taxor, for it will demand its due without fail.

meanings.definition: To impose a financial charge on someone or something.
meanings.sent1: She will taxor all businesses equally.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to taxor its customers for using their services.
meanings.sent3: He taxored his friends for borrowing his tools.
meanings.sent4: The government taxors its citizens to fund public services.
meanings.sent5: The landlord taxors the tenants for water usage every month.
